title: Citizen Science Developer
description: I led the development of [AnnoTate](https://anno.tate.org.uk/), a web application enabling the collaborative transcription of works in the Tate Museums' archives. This uses a custom Rails REST API for the back-end and data aggregation, Angular, Stylus and Gulp. The code is [available on GitHub](https://github.com/zooniverse/AnnoTate).

I also contributed significantly to two other transcription projects: [Shakespeare's World](http://www.shakespearesworld.org/), in connection with the Folger Shakespeare Library, and [Old Weather](http://www.oldweather.org/), with the Meterological Office. Additionally, through my work on these projects I won a Â£50,000 research grant to study building citizen science projects on Facebook.
My role also involves managing a team of two, interviewing developer candidates, project management and scheduling, and mentoring newer developers.

title: Front End Developer
description: At Incuna, I primarily built iPad apps using Backbone, Sass, and Grunt, and wrapping them in Cordova. I later streamlined this process by creating a custom Yeoman generator for new projects.
In addition, I built several responsive single page apps using Angular, and added D3 to produce dynamic data visualisations. I also worked on the front end for a number of Django websites.

title: Campaign Web Editor
organisation: University of Oxford Development Office, Oxford, UK
description: I developed, maintained and wrote content for several internal and external websites, all on different platforms. I also took on extra development opportunities where possible, building several WordPress sites with custom themes for special projects.
I also gained some experience in print design while creating various internal communications documents, and shooting video content for the websites.

title: Staff Writer
organisation: The Mainichi Newspapers Co., Tokyo, Japan
description: My primary roles were news gathering, writing and editing in both Japanese and English, translation, and photography. I also worked on a Javascript-driven bilingual comic series, and built a custom article archive for the site using KohanaPHP and MySQL.
